getAllIslandoraChildCollectionsMap

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllIslandoraChildCollectionsMap(Administrator administrator,
                                                                                                  java.lang.String namespace)
Gets all islandora collection names and their titles beneath the islandora:top level collection in the namespace
"" (empty string) will get all. The administrator is just used to get host,port,user,pwd info. The call to the resource index is actually via httpClient and rest call.
NOTE all islandora:* namespace collections are excluded.

Parameters:
administrator -
namespace -
Returns:
map of collection names and titles.
See Also:
FedoraAppBatchIngestController.getAdministrator()

getChildCollectionsMap

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getChildCollectionsMap(Administrator administrator,
                                                                                      java.lang.String topCollection,
                                                                                      java.lang.String namespace)
USED 2-2-12 The administrator is just used to get host,port,user,pwd info. The call to the resource index is actually via httpClient and rest call.

Parameters:
topCollection - such as islandora:top or codu:top
namespace - the names space of collections below the topCollection.

For example, to retrieve the collection names for coduDuMaps and coduDuPicture...

islandora:top - use topCollection=islandora:top and namespace=codu
   codu:duMaps
   codu:duPictures
   xxxx:yyyy
   zzzz:wwww

OR

islandora:top
   codu:top - use topCollection=codu:top and namespace=codu
      codu:duMaps
      codu:duPictures
Returns:
map of collection names and titles.

getAllIslandoraCollectionContentModelsMap

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllIslandoraCollectionContentModelsMap(Administrator administrator,
                                                                                                         java.lang.String collectionPID)
USED 2-2-12 Get all content models for a collection. If this object is not a collection, an empty map is returned. We return pid:pid (key and value both = pid) because we want to use the pid for the label in the form rather then the actual label. The administrator is just used to get host,port,user,pwd info. The call to the resource index is actually via httpClient and rest call.

Parameters:
administrator -
collectionPID -
Returns:
map of pid and pid for all content models in the collection (see above).
See Also:
FedoraAppBatchIngestController.getAdministrator()

isCollection

public static boolean isCollection(Administrator administrator,
                                   java.lang.String collectionPID)
USED 2-2-12 Try to access the COLLECTION_POLICY datastream to determine if this is a collection. On any error we assume object is NOT a collection.

Parameters:
administrator -
collectionPID -
Returns:
true if object is a collection
See Also:
FedoraAppBatchIngestController.getAdministrator()

isObjectInCollection

public static boolean isObjectInCollection(Administrator administrator,
                                           java.lang.String collectionPid,
                                           java.lang.String object)
Return true an object exists in an collection, this object may or may not be another collection, A COLLECTION OBJECT is considered to be a member of it's own Collection!!. This is needed for fedoraProxy. When fedoraProxy get's a request it always verifies that the requested object is within a web-sites collection for security reasons. Therefore if we want to get a a datastream within a collection object, it has to pass the isObjectInCollection() test.
If the collection object or the object is null, return false. The administrator is just used to get the host,port,user, and pwd info. The call to the resource index is actually via httpClient and rest call.

Parameters:
administrator -
collectionPid -
object -
Returns:
true if object is a child of the collection
See Also:
isCollection(Administrator, String), FedoraAppBatchIngestController.getAdministrator()

isObjectInCollection

public static boolean isObjectInCollection(java.lang.String host,
                                           int port,
                                           java.lang.String userName,
                                           java.lang.String password,
                                           java.lang.String collectionPid,
                                           java.lang.String object)

object -
Returns:
